  • public class Fraction
extends AlgebraicParticle
    Contains a fraction with expressions on top and bottom.
    Author:
    Nateowami

      boolean isSimplified()
      Tells if the fraction is fully simplified, that is, that both top and bottom are instances of Number, are both whole numbers, the bottom is not negative, the bottom is greater than the top, and they have no common factors (other than 1).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Fraction

        protected Fraction(java.lang.String frac)
        Constructs a new Fraction.
        Parameters:
        frac - The String from which to construct the fraction, in the form of expression/expression. If an expression has more than one term it must be surrounded by parentheses.

    • Method Detail

      • parseable

        public static boolean parseable(java.lang.String frac)
        Tells if a String is in the form of (expression)/(expression).
        Parameters:
        frac - The String in question.
        Returns:
        If frac is a valid fraction.

      • getTop

        public AlgebraicParticle getTop()
        Returns:

      • getBottom

        public AlgebraicParticle getBottom()
        Returns:
        The bottom expression of the fraction.

      • isSimplified

        public boolean isSimplified()
        Tells if the fraction is fully simplified, that is, that both top and bottom are instances of Number, are both whole numbers, the bottom is not negative, the bottom is greater than the top, and they have no common factors (other than 1).
        Returns:
        True if the fraction is fully simplified, otherwise false.

      • indexOfSlash

        private static int indexOfSlash(java.lang.String frac)
        Tells the index of the first non-nested slash (/). If there is no slash not nested in parentheses, it returns -1 Example: indexOfSlash("2/3") returns 1 indexOfSlash("(4/5)") returns -1 indexOfSlash("(4+6)/(8)") returns 5
        Parameters:
        frac - The fraction from which to search for the slash.
        Returns:
        The index of the first non-nested forward slash.
